etymology.description: 目(目) (mù, 'eye') + 人(人) (rén, 'person') = a person looking back -> concept of disobedience or limit
etymology.interpretation: The character 艮(gěn) depicts a person turning around to look back, symbolizing hesitation or obstruction. The association with stopping or limiting arises from the act of looking back as a check on forward movement.

examples.chinese: 火车在车站艮停(火車在車站艮停)。
examples.english: The train is stopping at the station.

examples.chinese: 他前行至半途便艮住(他前行至半途便艮住)。
examples.pinyin: tā qiánxíng zhì bàntú biàn gěn zhù.
examples.english: He stopped halfway through his journey.

examples.chinese: 研究易经时(研究易經時)，学者发现艮象寓意着停止(學者發現艮象寓意著停止)。
examples.pinyin: yánjiū yìjīng shí, xuézhě fāxiàn gěn xiàng yùyì zhe tíngzhǐ.
examples.english: While studying the I Ching, scholars discovered that the image of Gèn implies stopping.
